intro: Ricinocarpus spiciflorus, commonly known as the spikeflower ricinocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, thriving in moist, swampy conditions. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
